in the old churchyard to enjoy the beauty before the sun dip below the black mass of kettleness standing boldly athwart the western sky its downward way be mark by myriad cloud of every sunset colour flame purple pink green violet and all the tint of gold with here and there mass not large but seemingly of absolute blackness in all sort of shape as well outline as colossal silhouette the experience be not lose on the painter and doubtless some of the sketch of the prelude to the great storm will grace the and wall in may next more than one captain make up his mind then and there that his cobble or his mule as they term the different class of boat would remain in the harbour till the storm have pass the wind fall away entirely during the evening and at midnight there be a dead calm a sultry heat and that prevail intensity which on the approach of thunder affect person of a sensitive nature there be but few light in sight at sea for even the coast steamer which usually hug the shore so closely keep well to seaward and but few fishing boat be in sight the only sail noticeable be a foreign schooner with all sail set which be seemingly go westward the foolhardiness or ignorance of her officer be a prolific theme for comment whilst she remain in sight and effort be make to signal she to reduce sail in face of her danger before the night shut down she be see with sail idly flap as she gently roll on the undulating swell of the sea as idle as a paint ship upon a paint ocean shortly before ten the stillness of the air grow quite oppressive and the silence be so marked that the bleating of a sheep inland or the barking of a dog in the town be distinctly hear and the band on the pier with its lively french air be like a discord in the great harmony of nature silence a little after midnight come a strange sound from over the sea and high overhead the air begin to carry a strange faint hollow booming then without warn the tempest break with a rapidity which at the time seem incredible and even afterwards be impossible to realise the whole aspect of nature at once become convulse the wave rise in grow fury each over top its fellow till in a very few
